member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which is used to customize the primary x-axis of the 3D Chart.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DAxes>
                    <Chart3DAxis ValueType = "Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category" RowIndex="0" ColumnIndex="0" Name="XAxis"></Chart3DAxis>
                </Chart3DAxes>
            
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName = "Browser" YName="Users" XAxisName="XAxis" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails" Type="Chart3DSeriesType.Column">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3},
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5},
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Firefox", Users = 3},
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Samsung Internet", Users = 2.6},
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4},
                };
            }

member.value: An instance of . The default value is instance of .
member.remarks: By using this class we can add multiple axes to the 3D Chart. Each axis can be customized with different properties. This is child component of .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.RangePadding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the padding for the axis range in terms of interval.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the range padding of the axis. The options include:
: Padding is applied based on the axis orientation.
: Padding cannot be applied to the axis.
: Padding is applied to the axis based on the range calculation.
: Interval of the axis is added as padding to the minimum and maximum values of the range.
: Axis range is rounded to the nearest possible value divisible by the interval.
The default value is .
member.remarks: When the RangePadding is set to , the padding is applied based on the axis orientation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.ValueType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of data the axis is handling.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the value type of the axis. Options include:
: Renders a numeric axis.
: Renders a date time axis.
: Renders a category axis.
: Renders a logarithmic axis.
: Renders a date time category axis.
The default value is .
member.remarks: This property determines the type of data the axis is handling, affecting how axis values are interpreted and displayed on the . It is essential to set this property correctly based on the nature of the data being plotted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.EdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the placement of labels at the edge of the axis.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specify the edge label placement for the axis. Options include:
: No action will be performed, and the label will be rendered as it is.
: Hides the edge label if it exceeds the area.
: Shifts the edge labels within the area.
The default mode is .
member.remarks: The longer text labels at the axis edges may only be partially visible in the . Utilize this property to place the edge labels efficiently for a better user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.IntervalType
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval type for DateTime-based data on the axis.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the interval type for the DateTime-based axis. Options include:
: Defines the interval of the axis based on the data.
: Defines the interval of the axis in years.
: Defines the interval of the axis in months.
: Defines the interval of the axis in days.
: Defines the interval of the axis in hours.
: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.
The default value is .
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the interval type for DateTime-based data on the axis. The interval type determines how the axis labels are displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of that controls the customization of minor grid lines.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks:
This property can be used to customize the color, width, and dash array of the minor grid lines.
Note: Minor grid lines will be rendered only when is provided with a value greater than zero.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to arrange axis labels intelligently when they intersect with each other.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the alignment of axis labels when they intersect. Options include:
: Show all labels, regardless of intersections.
: Hide labels that intersect with each other.
: Trim labels to fit within the available space when they intersect.
: Wrap labels to multiple lines when they intersect.
: Display labels in multiple rows when they intersect.
: Rotate labels by 45 degrees when they intersect.
: Rotate labels by 90 degrees when they intersect.
The default LabelIntersectAction is .
member.remarks: Note: For the vertical axis, the option is the only applicable choice.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.IsInversed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis should be rendered in an inversed manner.
member.value: true if the axis should be rendered in an inversed manner; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If set to true, the axis will be rendered with the greatest value on the axis moving closer to the origin, and vice versa.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.StartFromZero
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the numeric axis should start from zero.
member.value: true if the numeric axis starts from zero; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is only applicable for numeric axes.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxisLabelStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the customization options for the axis label font style of the 3D Chart.
member.value: An instance of representing the customization options for axis label font style. The default value is instance of .
member.remarks: Use the class to customize the font style and appearance of axis labels in the 3D Chart. This class inherits properties from the class, allowing you to define font-related settings such as font family, size, style, and weight.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxisLabelStyle.FontSize

member.remarks: The FontSize property allows you to specify the font size for rendering axis labels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxisLabelStyle.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the font color for axis labels.
member.value: A string representing the font color for axis labels. The default font color is determined by the chart's theme. By default, the theme is set to with a font color of rgba(97, 97, 97, 1).
member.remarks: Use valid hex or rgba CSS color strings for the color value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxisLabelStyle.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family for axis labels.
member.value: A string representing the font family for axis labels. The default font family is determined by the chart's theme. By default, the theme is set to with the font family Roboto.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DAxisLabelStyle.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight for axis labels.
member.value: A string representing the font weight for axis labels. The default font weight is determined by the chart's theme. By default, the theme is set to with a font weight of 400.
member.remarks: The FontWeight property allows you to specify the thickness or boldness of the font used for rendering axis labels. Common values include "Normal", "Bold", "Bolder", "Lighter", or numeric values such as 100, 200, ..., 900.

Gets or sets the major grid lines of the 3D Chart axis.
Accepts an instance of representing the major grid lines of the 3D Chart axis. The default value is an instance of . 9
Use this class to customize the major grid lines of the 3D Chart axis. The major grid lines are the horizontal or vertical lines that run across the plot area to help in better understanding the data points on the chart.

member.remarks: Use valid hex or rgba CSS color strings for the color value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DPrimaryXAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which is used to customize the primary x-axis of the 3D Chart.
member.value: An instance of .

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                <Chart3DPrimaryXAxis Title="Browser Name" LabelFormat="{value} Month" Format="MMM" IsIndexed="false" MaximumLabels="5" OpposedPosition="false" RangePadding="ChartRangePadding.None"
                                     ValueType="Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category" IntervalType="IntervalType.Months" Interval="2" Name="PrimaryXAxis" Visible="true" MinorTicksPerInterval="1" Minimum="0.5"
                                     Maximum="8" LogBase="100" ColumnIndex="0" RowIndex="0" Span="1" MaxLabelWidth="50" EnableTrim="true" EdgeLabelPlacement="EdgeLabelPlacement.Hide"
                                     LabelPlacement="LabelPlacement.BetweenTicks" LabelIntersectAction="LabelIntersectAction.Rotate45" LabelRotationAngle="45" LabelPadding="10" TitlePadding="15" IsInversed="false"
                                     PlotOffset="10" PlotOffsetBottom="5" PlotOffsetLeft="5" PlotOffsetRight="5" PlotOffsetTop="5" DesiredIntervals="5" TitleRotationAngle="90" StartFromZero="true">
                    <Chart3DAxisMajorGridLines Color="red" Width="2"></Chart3DAxisMajorGridLines>
                    <Chart3DAxisMajorTickLines Color="red" Width="1" Height="15"></Chart3DAxisMajorTickLines>
                    <Chart3DMinorGridLines Color="blue" Width="0.5"></Chart3DMinorGridLines>
                    <Chart3DAxisMinorTickLines Color="blue" Width="0.5" Height="10"></Chart3DAxisMinorTickLines>
                    <Chart3DAxisTitleStyle FontFamily="Arial" Color="Gray" FontStyle="Bold" FontWeight="600" FontSize="14px" Opacity="0.9" TextOverflow="TextOverflow.Wrap"></Chart3DAxisTitleStyle>
                </Chart3DPrimaryXAxis>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Firefox”, Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Samsung Internet”, Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.remarks: Use this class to customize the primary x-axis of the 3D Chart such as axis interval, range, and label settings.

One of the enumerations that specifies the alignment of the text. Options include:

One of the enumerations that specifies the text overflow options. Options include:
: Trims the text if it exceeds the defined margins.
: Wraps the text if it exceeds the defined margins.
: Shows the text as it is.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DLegendSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the legend customization options for the 3D Chart component.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            	
                <Chart3DPrimaryXAxis ValueType="Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category">
                </Chart3DPrimaryXAxis>
            
                <Chart3DLegendSettings Alignment="Alignment.Center" Background="red" Visible="true" Width="350px" Height="50px" Position="LegendPosition.Bottom" ShapeHeight="20" ShapeWidth="20"
                ToggleVisibility="false" Reverse="true">
                    <Chart3DLegendBorder Color="red" Width="2"></Chart3DLegendBorder>
                    <Chart3DLegendMargin Bottom="5" Left="5" Top="5" Right="5"></Chart3DLegendMargin>
                    <Chart3DLegendTextStyle FontFamily="Arial" Color="Gray" FontStyle="Bold" FontWeight="600" FontSize="14px" Opacity="0.9" TextOverflow="TextOverflow.Trim"></Chart3DLegendTextStyle>
                    <Chart3DLegendTitleStyle FontFamily="Arial" Color="Gray" FontStyle="Bold" FontWeight="600" FontSize="14px" Opacity="0.9" TextOverflow="TextOverflow.Trim"></Chart3DLegendTitleStyle>
                </Chart3DLegendSettings>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Firefox", Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Samsung Internet", Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Opera", Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts the instance of class. The default value is instance of .
member.remarks: Use this class to customize the legend appearance in the 3D Chart. The legend can be positioned at the top, left, bottom, or right of the chart area.

member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of that specifies the location of the legend relative to the 3D Chart. If x is set to 20, the legend will move 20 pixels to the right of the 3D Chart.
member.value: The default value is an instance of .
member.remarks: The must be set to LegendPosition.Custom to position the legend in the 3D Chart using the specified x and y offsets.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DLegendSettings.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the legend in the .
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the position of the legend. Options include:
: Places the legend based on the width and height of the chart.
: Displays the legend at the top of the chart.
: Displays the legend at the left of the chart.
: Displays the legend at the bottom of the chart.
: Displays the legend at the right of the chart.
: Displays the legend based on the given x and y location values.
The default mode is .
member.remarks: Use this property to position the legend at the top, left, bottom, or right of the 3D Chart. By default, the legend will be placed at the bottom of the 3D Chart.

One of the enumeration that specifies the position of the legend. The options include:
: Displays the legend based on the series in the 3D Chart.
: Displays the legend based on the data points in the 3D Chart.
The default value is .
member.remarks: Use this property to display the legend based on the series or data points in the 3D Chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DLegendSettings.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the legend.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the legend alignment. Options include: - Near: Aligns the legend to the left or top based on the . - Center: Aligns the legend to the center of the 3D chart. - Far: Aligns the legend to the right or bottom based on the .
The default value is Alignment.Center.
member.remarks: The alignment of the legend works as follows: - Near: Aligns the legend to the top-left of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right-top of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Right. - Center: Aligns the legend to the top center of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right center of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Right. - Far: Aligns the legend to the top-right of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right-bottom of the 3D chart if is LegendPosition.Right.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for customizing the 3D Chart series.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" XAxisName="PrimaryXAxis" YAxisName="PrimaryYAxis" PointColorMapping="Color" Visible="true" Fill="SKyblue"
                                   DataSource="@StatisticsDetails" Query="@query" Name="Users" Type="Chart3DSeriesType.Column" EnableTooltip="true" TooltipFormat="${series.name} : ${point.y}K" TooltipMappingName="Users"
                                   ColumnWidth="0.7" LegendShape="LegendShape.Circle" StackingGroup="Group 1" Opacity="0.6" GroupName="Country" ColumnFacet="Chart3DShapeType.Cylinder"
                                   ColumnSpacing="0.1">
                        <Chart3DAnimation Enable="true" Delay="200" Duration="2000"></Chart3DAnimation>
                        <Chart3DEmptyPointSettings Fill="gray" Mode="EmptyPointMode.Average">
                            <Chart3DEmptyPointBorder Color="green" Width="2"></Chart3DEmptyPointBorder>
                        </Chart3DEmptyPointSettings>
                        <Chart3DDataLabel Visible="true" NameField="Browser" Fill="blue" Format="N2" Opacity="0.9" DataLabelAngle="30" EnableRotation="true" Position="Chart3DDataLabelPosition.Top">
                        </Chart3DDataLabel>
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                Query query = new Query();
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 37, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "UC Browser", Users = 17, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "iPhone", Users = 19, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Others", Users = 4, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Opera", Users = 11, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Android", Users = 12, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts the instance of the class. The default value is a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The is child component of the . It is used to render the series in the 3D Chart. We can provide "n” number of series to the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.XName
member.summary: Gets or sets the field that contains the x value.
member.value: Accepts string value of the field name in the data source. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: The property specifies the field name in the data source that contains the x value for the chart series. Assign the name of the corresponding field in the data source to this property to map the x values correctly. If not explicitly set, the default value is an empty string.

member.value: Accepts string value of the color field name. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: The property specifies the field name in the data source that contains the color information for each point in the chart series. Assign the name of the corresponding field in the data source to this property to map point colors correctly. If not explicitly set, the default value is an empty string, indicating that no color mapping is performed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the 3D Chart series.
member.value: Accepts valid CSS color string values such as hexadecimal, rgba, and color names. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The property specifies the fill color for the series in the 3D Chart. You can use valid CSS color string values, such as hexadecimal (#RRGGBB), rgba (rgba(R,G,B,A)), or color names (e.g., "red", "blue"). Setting this property applies the specified fill color to the series. If not explicitly set, the default value is null, indicating that the series uses the default fill color defined by the chart theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for the 3D Chart series.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails" Name="Users" Type="Chart3DSeriesType.Column">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                <Chart3DPrimaryXAxis ValueType="Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category"></Chart3DPrimaryXAxis>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Firefox”, Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Samsung Internet”, Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts the IEnumerable object as a data source. Also, it can be an expando object, dynamic object, or list of objects. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The property allows you to bind data to the 3D Chart. You can use an IEnumerable object, an expando object, a dynamic object, or a list of objects as the data source. To consume data from a remote service or custom adaptor, use the .

member.remarks: This property is applicable only when the DataSource is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the series in the component. The series name is displayed as the legend text for the series, providing a descriptive label in the chart's legend.
member.value: Accepts a string value representing the name of the series. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: The property specifies the name of the series, which is used as the legend text for the series in the chart. Assign a descriptive name to this property to provide meaningful labels in the chart's legend for each series. If not explicitly set, the default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.StackingGroup
member.summary: Specifies the grouping of series in stacked Column/Bar 3D Charts. If two or more series share the same value, they will be grouped together.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only to stacking series types.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the 3D Chart series.
member.value: Accepts the double value. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: The property controls the transparency of the 3D Chart series. Set this property to a value between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (fully opaque) to adjust the opacity of the series. A value of 0 makes the series completely invisible, while a value of 1 makes it fully visible. The default value is 1, indicating full opacity.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.GroupName
member.summary: Specifies a name for the group that defines series which are mutually exclusive and can be overlaid. Series within the same group share the same baseline and location on the corresponding axis.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The property assigns a name to a group of mutually exclusive series that can be overlaid on the 3D Chart. Series within the same group share the same base-line and location on the corresponding axis. Use this property to organize and manage series that should be displayed together.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.Type
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of series for the component. Possible values are:
: Represents vertical column series.
: Represents horizontal bar series.
: Represents stacked vertical column series.
: Represents stacked horizontal bar series.
: Represents 100% stacked vertical column series.
: Represents 100% stacked horizontal bar series.
The default value is .
member.value: Accepts the enum value. The default value is .
member.remarks: The property specifies the type of series to be displayed in the 3D chart. Choose one of the available values from the enumeration to define the appearance and behavior of the series. If not explicitly set, the default value is , representing vertical column series.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.EnableTooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to toggle the tooltip option for the series.
member.value: Accepts a boolean value. The default value is true.
member.remarks: The property controls whether tooltips are enabled for the series in the chart. Set this property to true to enable tooltips for the series, providing additional information on data points when hovered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.TooltipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip format for the specific 3D Chart series.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks:
The property allows customization of the tooltip format for the specific series over common . By default, the tooltip displays information for the x and y values of a point. Additional information can be included in the tooltip using a format string.
For example, the format "$series.name: $point.x" displays the series name and xvalue of the point in the tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.TooltipField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field name to get the tooltip text from the data source.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: The property specifies the field name in the data source from which to fetch the tooltip text for each data point in the series. Assign the name of the corresponding field in the data source to this property to enable tooltips with custom text for each point in the series. If not explicitly set, the default value is an empty string, indicating that tooltips will use default text or values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.LegendShape
member.summary:
Gets or sets the option to customize the legend shape for the series. Possible values are:
: Represents the legend shape as the series type.
: Represents the legend shape as a circle.
: Represents the legend shape as a rectangle.
: Represents the legend shape as a diamond.
: Represents the legend shape as a cross.
: Represents the legend shape as a vertical line.
: Represents the legend shape as a horizontal line.
: Represents the legend shape as a triangle.
: Represents the legend shape as a pentagon.
: Represents the legend shape as an inverted triangle.
: Represents the legend shape as the multiply.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" NameField="Browsers" LegendShape="LegendShape.Circle">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3},
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Firefox”, Users = 3 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Samsung Internet”, Users = 2.6 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4 },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts the LegendShape enum value. The default value is SeriesType.
member.remarks: When the is set to SeriesType, the legend shape is displayed based on the series type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the column series.
member.value: Accepts the double value ranges from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.7.
member.remarks: The property specifies the width of the column series in the chart, as a percentage of the available space. The value should be between 0 and 1, where 0 represents no width (invisible) and 1 represents full width. The default value is 0.7, which provides a balanced width for column series in most cases.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.ColumnFacet
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 3D column or bar chart rendering facet. The available options are:
Rectangle
Cylinder
member.value: Accepts a value from the enum. The default value is .
member.remarks: The property determines the rendering facet for 3D column or bar chart series in the 3D Chart. Choose between Rectangle and Cylinder options to define the appearance of the columns or bars in the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DSeries.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the space between adjacent 3D Chart series.
member.value: Accepts the double value ranges from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.1.
member.remarks: The property controls the space between adjacent series in the 3D Chart. Use this property to adjust the gap between columns or bars in a 3D column or bar chart. The value should be between 0 (no spacing) and 1 (maximum spacing relative to the series width). A smaller value results in tighter spacing between series, while a larger value increases the gap. The default value is 0.1, providing a moderate spacing between adjacent series.

member.remarks: The property allows customization of how empty points are displayed in the 3D Chart series. Use this property to configure appearance and behavior for data points that have null or undefined values. By default, a new instance of the class is used, providing default settings for empty points. Customize the settings as needed based on the desired visual representation of empty points in the chart series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.Chart3DDataLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for customizing the data labels in the 3D Chart series.
member.value: An instance of the class representing the data label customization options. The default value is a new instance of the class.

example.code:
<SfChart3D>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails">
                        <Chart3DDataLabel Visible="true" NameField="Browser" Fill="blue" Format="N2" Opacity="0.9" DataLabelAngle="30" EnableRotation="true" Position="Chart3DDataLabelPosition.Top">
                              <Chart3DDataLabelBorder Color="red" Width="2"></Chart3DDataLabelBorder>
                              <Chart3DDataLabelMargin Bottom="5" Left="5" Right="5" Top="5"></Chart3DDataLabelMargin>
                              <Chart3DDataLabelFont FontFamily="Arial" Color="Gray" FontStyle="Bold" FontWeight="600" FontSize="14px" Opacity="0.9" TextOverflow="TextOverflow.Wrap"></Chart3DDataLabelFont>
                        </Chart3DDataLabel>
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Firefox”, Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Samsung Internet”, Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.remarks: Use the class to customize the appearance and behavior of data labels in the 3D Chart series. This class allows you to configure settings such as font, color, position, and visibility of data labels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.Palettes
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette for the 3D Chart series.

example.code:
<SfChart3D Palettes="@palettes">
                <Chart3DPrimaryXAxis ValueType="Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category" Title="Browser"/>
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries DataSource="@StatisticsDetails" XName="Browser" YName="Users" Type="Chart3DSeriesType.Column">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            
            @code {
                string[] palettes = new string[] { "#FFD700", "#C0C0C0", "#CD7F32", "#FFA07A", "#808080", "#008000" };
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 37 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "UC Browser", Users = 17 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "iPhone", Users = 19 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Others", Users = 4  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Opera", Users = 11 },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Android", Users = 12 },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts a string array that specifies the palette for 3D Chart series. The default value is an empty string array.
member.remarks: Multiple series will be applied with fill color based on the order of values in the palette array.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.Theme
member.summary: Gets or sets the theme for the 3D Chart.
member.value: One of the enumerations that specifies the theme of the 3D Chart component. The default value is Theme.Material.
member.remarks: 3D Chart element's color and text get modified, such as fill, font size, font family, and font style, which enhances the overall 3D Chart appearance based on the predefined theme applied.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.HighlightMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the highlight mode of the component.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies how the component should highlight elements. Available options include:
: No highlighting will occur.
: Series will be highlighted when hovered.
: Individual points will be highlighted when hovered.
: A cluster of points across all series with the same index will be highlighted when hovered.
The default value is .
member.remarks: Set the property to specify how the component should highlight elements when hovered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.HighlightColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the highlight color for the 3D Chart.
member.value: A string representing the highlight color. Accepts valid CSS color string values.
member.remarks: Applicable only when is applied. 3D Chart points, series or a cluster of points (based on the applied and 3D Chart series type) will be displayed in the provided HighlightColor when the user hovers over them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.SelectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode of the component.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the selection mode of the component. The options include:
: No selection will occur.
: Selects a series.
: Selects a single point.
: Selects the points in all series that correspond to the same index.
The default value is .
member.remarks: The option disables selection in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether multiple selection is enabled in the 3D Chart.
member.value: true if multiple selection can be enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only when is applied. Enabling this property allows the selection of multiple points or series (based on the applied).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.UseGroupingSeparator

member.value: true if the grouping separator can be enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.TiltAngle

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for the 3D Chart.

example.code:
<SfChart3D DataSource="@StatisticsDetails" >
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" Name="Users" Type="Chart3DSeriesType.Column">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                <Chart3DPrimaryXAxis ValueType="Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ValueType.Category"></Chart3DPrimaryXAxis>
            </SfChart3D>
            @code {
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Firefox”, Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Samsung Internet”, Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = “Opera”, Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.value: Accepts the IEnumerable object as a data source. Also, it can be an expando object, dynamic object, or list of objects. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The property allows you to bind data to the 3D Chart. You can use an IEnumerable object, an expando object, a dynamic object, or a list of objects as the data source. To consume data from a remote service or custom adaptor, use the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.EnableSideBySidePlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable side-by-side placement of series.
member.value: true if side-by-side placement can be enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Set the property to control whether series are placed side by side in the chart. When enabled, series are positioned next to each other horizontally or vertically, depending on the chart type. Disabling side-by-side placement may result in series overlapping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.PerspectiveAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the perspective angle of the 3D Chart.
member.value: Accepts the double value. The default value is 90.
member.remarks: The property controls the perspective angle of the 3D Chart. A higher angle value results in a wider field of view, while a lower value creates a more compressed perspective. Adjusting this property can change the appearance of the chart to suit different viewing preferences.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.WallColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the 3D wall for 3D Chart.
member.value: Accepts the string value that specifies the 3D wall color of the 3D Chart. The default value is “”.
member.remarks: The property allows you to set the color of the wall in the 3D Chart. Specify a color using a string value, such as hex codes (#RRGGBB) or color names. If not set, the default color is used for the wall based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.IsTransposed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the 3D Chart should be rendered in a transposed manner.
member.value: true if transposing can be enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If set to true, the 3D Chart will be rendered in a transposed manner with the horizontal axis placed as the vertical axis and vice versa.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.PrintAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference)
member.summary: Asynchronously prints the specified element referenced by the optional parameter. If no element reference is provided, the chart will print.
member.param: Optional reference to the element to be printed. If not provided, the chart is printed.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous printing operation.

example.code:
<SfChart3D @ref="chart3dObj" >
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            <button @onclick="PrintChart">PrintChart</button>
            @code {
               SfChart3D chart3dObj;
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
                public async Task PrintChart()
                {
                   await chart3dObj.Print3DAsync();
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Firefox", Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Samsung Internet", Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Opera", Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.SfChart3D.ExportAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Chart3D.ExportType,System.String,System.Nullable{Syncfusion.PdfExport.PdfPageOrientation},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The method is used to perform the export functionality for the rendered 3D Chart.
member.param: Specifies the export type for the rendered 3D Chart.
Specifies the portrait or landscape orientation of the page.
Specifies whether to download or not.
Specify whether to obtain the 3D Chart image as a base64 string or not.
member.returns: Export the 3D Chart with sepcifies export type.

example.code:
<SfChart3D @ref="chart3dObj" >
                <Chart3DSeriesCollection>
                    <Chart3DSeries XName="Browser" YName="Users" DataSource="@StatisticsDetails">
                    </Chart3DSeries>
                </Chart3DSeriesCollection>
            </SfChart3D>
            <button @onclick="ExportChart">ExportChart</button>
            @code {
               SfChart3D chart3dObj;
                public class Statistics
                {
                    public string Browser { get; set; }
                    public double Users { get; set; }
                    public string Color { get; set; }
                }
                public async Task ExportChart()
                {
                   await chart3dObj.Export3DAsync(ExportType.PNG, "3DChart");
                }
            
                public List<Statistics> StatisticsDetails = new List<Statistics>
                {
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Chrome", Users = 65.3, Color = "red" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Safari", Users = 18.3, Color = "blue" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Edge", Users = 5, Color = "green" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Firefox", Users = 3, Color = "orange"  },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Samsung Internet", Users = 2.6, Color = "yellow" },
                    new Statistics { Browser = "Opera", Users = 2.4, Color = "pink" },
                };
            }
